Auto Accidents Involving Uber And Other Ride-Hailing Services

As ride-booking services become more popular, the potential for car accidents involving these vehicles increases. Unlike a public transportation driver, drivers of ride-hailing services like Uber, Lyft and Sidecar do not require any special training or instruction. They are simply everyday drivers like you and me who want to make some extra money by giving people rides around the Columbus area.

So what happens when you or a loved one is injured from a ride-hailing driver while crossing the street? How about as a passenger?

Depending on the circumstances, the law can be tricky when it comes to these types of accidents. Determining responsibility and insurance company liability can be complex.

Only An Experienced Lawyer Can Recover Maximum Compensation For You

It takes an experienced lawyer to ensure that you recover the maximum compensation possible following an accident with a ride-hailing driver.

Our attorneys at Lamkin, Van Eman, Trimble & Dougherty, LLC, have extensive experience representing injured clients in the Columbus area and in communities throughout central Ohio who have been involved in these and other types of auto accidents.

If you were involved in a taxi accident, our lawyers at Lamkin, Van Eman, Trimble & Dougherty, LLC, can talk with you about the circumstances, the law and the legal process of monetary recovery. Let us provide the answers you need so you can make an informed decision about your situation.
